item.title: Humans vs Zombies Weeklong
item.description: Weeklong signups are now open! The termly HvZ weeklong returns November 10th to 14th. This time, you'll be joining the set of Game Changer as cast or crew as they shoot a zombie-based episode. Signups are, as always, on our website at https://uwhvz.uwaterloo.ca/, or in person at our SLC booth on Monday and Friday Never played a weeklong? Get the rundown on our website. Even if you've played before, take a moment to brush up on the rules at https://tinyurl.com/TasJpbCsu9.

item.title: Real Talk & Resumes
item.description:
Join us on Monday November 10th from 4-6pm in ML 349 for a night of learning and fun!

item.title: Navigating Whatâ€™s Next With Your Arts Degree
item.description: If the future feels uncertain, youâ€™re not alone! This workshop is designed for upper-year students who want to start shaping what comes after graduation: whether that means finding meaningful work, pursuing further studies, or exploring new directions. In this workshop, you will: â€¢Identify your key skills, interests, and values, and learn how they connect to potential career paths. â€¢Discover ways to pivot and reframe your experiences to open up new opportunities. â€¢Explore practical strategies to test your ideas, such as informational interviews, short term projects, or volunteering. â€¢Leave with a clearer sense of direction and concrete next steps to begin your journey. Please note: this workshop is for upper year undergraduate and graduate students in the Faculty of Arts. Registration on the Career Centre Events calendar on WaterlooWorks.

item.title: Philosophy Of Commemoration And Remembrance
item.description:
In collaboration with the UW History Society, Dr Geoff Hayes, and Dr Nick Ray, we are excited to announce our next event: Philosophy of Commemoration and Remembrance.
The event will feature a panel-style discussion between Professors Dr Hayes and Dr Ray, as they answer questions about history and philosophy. There will be a special focus on how we study, teach, and remember the past - especially in the age of AI and digital memory.
The event will include a Q & A period for questions from the audience.

We hope you join us for a night of conversion and reflection. Snacks and drinks will be provided.

Theyâ€™re not just pitching, theyâ€™re competing for funding, mentorship, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact on our student community. Whatâ€™s in it for you?

item.title: AMATH Prof Talk
item.description:
Come join us for an AMATH Prof Talk on neural networks and dynamical systems!
Abstract: In machine learning, neural networks are often used in a feed-forward manner. Or, when a population of neurons is recurrently connected, the updates happen in synchronized jumps. But the neurons in your brain are operating in continuous time. I will show you some ways to bridge the gap to biology, and treat networks of interconnected neurons as a dynamical system. Then, we'll co-opt those networks to do our bidding, and get them to solve dynamical systems.
Pizza and refreshments will be provided to PMC members.

The University of Waterloo Tamil Networking Association (UWATNA), in collaboration with the Laurier University Tamil Studentsâ€™ Association (LUTSA), invites you to our Campus Maaveerar Naal Commemoration Ceremony, â€˜Our Heroes, Our Legacy,â€™ time to reflect, remember, and honour the enduring legacy of our heroes whose bravery, sacrifice, and unity continue to inspire generations of Tamils worldwide

item.title: From Outages to Ownership
item.description:
From Outages to Ownership: Disaster Recovery, DNS, and Career Journeys in Okta Engineering
Ready to see how a top tech company handles the really big challenges? Join us and our Okta engineers for an evening focused on the critical work that keeps our services running; even when major outages happen. Our Staff Software Engineer will kick off the event with a fascinating technical talk, diving into DNS, redundancy, and disaster recovery based on her real-world experience at Okta. Itâ€™s a timely look at how engineering teams build for reliability at scale.
After the deep-dive, youâ€™ll hear from a panel of Engineers from various teams as they share their own career paths, offer a peek into their day-to-day work, and give you practical advice for launching your career. Stick around for our informal networking mixer to connect one-on-one with the team and ask any final questions!

item.title: Womenâ€™s Centre X Glow Centre Chest Casting Workshop
item.description:
Join the Womenâ€™s Centre and Glow on Friday, November 21 in the Womenâ€™s Centre (SLC 3104) for an event celebrating your body in a safe environment! Create a plaster cast of your chest as a way to honour and connect with your body.
No matter the size and shape of your bust, every woman-identifying person and non-binary-identifying person is welcome at the event!
There will also be a discussion on the sexualization and feminization of chests, and how these narratives can perpetuate transphobia and body image issues. Together, weâ€™ll explore new ways of seeing our bodies to help foster more positive and affirming self-perception.
Three FREE sessions are available: 11AM â€“ 12 PM 1 PM â€“ 2 PM 3 PM â€“ 4 PM* Glow Centre â€“ run session
Registration will be open from November 3 through November 21 at 3 p.m., or until all available spots are filled. Please register early to secure your place using the link below!
âš ï¸ Accessibility, Comfort & Health Notice
This is a messy craft activity using paper mÃ¢chÃ© materials, so please wear clothes you donâ€™t mind getting dirty.
Participants will remove clothing from their upper body in a small, private group setting (about 10 people). We understand this can feel vulnerable â€” please know itâ€™s a safe and body-positive space, and you can opt out or pause at any time.
If you have allergies, skin sensitivities, or accessibility needs, please contact us in advance so we can make accommodations.
This event is exclusive to Waterloo undergrad students.

item.title: Murder Mystery Dinner (MMD)
item.description:
Dear Esteemed Guest,
I humbly invite you immortal souls to embark upon grand experience on these lightless night to taste the dew of the divine.
On the 21 of November from 6:30pm SLC The Bombshelter, we shall remember forevermore the eternal night of this exclusive feast.
For a small tithe, come one and all to experience the trill of timeless spring.
Well Regard, Your Eternal Guide - Mr. Sun
Only 30 spots are available, so RSVP using the link in our bio
Murder Mystery Dinner (MMD) is a purely social LARP as you navigate the titular murder of the night. Set in a supernatural roaring 20s of immortals, if the web of intrigue and interest of a party appeal to you, come along.
This is a paid event. This event has a $10.00 entry fee while to our WatSFiC Patrons thatâ€™s only $5.00

item.title: University of Waterloo Accounting Conference 2025
item.description:
The UWAC Team is thrilled to announce that registration for UWAC 2025 is now open! Register for a chance to compete for cash prizes, build valuable skills through sponsor-led workshops, and connect with students and industry professionals at Canadaâ€™s leading undergraduate accounting conference! The conference will take place on Saturday, November 22nd, hosted at Hagey Hall on the University of Waterloo campus.
Teams will consist of four members, and you can either register with a group of friends or let us assign you a team. The registration deadline is FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 7TH at 11:59 PM, but sign up before November 2nd to take advantage of our early bird pricing and save $10!
Early bird pricing (until November 2nd): $20 Regular pricing: $30
Sign up by paying for the ticket on the WUSA website AND submitting your application using our Google Form (https://forms.gle/zucuboQK1KwnkXKs9). You must complete BOTH forms to officially register! Spots are limited and will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis, so make sure every team member signs up!
For any questions or concerns, reach out to us at info@uwac.ca or through our social media. We canâ€™t wait to see you at the conference on November 22nd!

item.title: Voices Empower Walk
item.description: Join us for the Voices Empower Walk on November 22. Meet at the UWaterloo ION Station at 12:20 PM or at Uptown Square before 1 PM. The event runs from 1â€“4 PM. Everyone is welcome. Every six days in Canada, a woman is killed by her intimate partner. In 2024 alone, 187 femicides were recorded nationwide 62 in Ontario between November 2023 and November 2024. This rise in violence demands action. We cannot stay silent. When we walk together, we honor those lost, stand with survivors, and raise funds to help women, gender-diverse people, and children move beyond violence. Together, we walk for change. ðŸ’œ
